markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Gray Maiden Plate](/Armor.aspx?ID=15)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Bulwark" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=202" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Shadows at Sundown](/Sources.aspx?ID=121) pg. 53</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 35 gp

**AC Bonus** +6

**Dex Cap** +0

**Check Penalty** -3

**Speed Penalty** -10 ft.
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 16

**Bulk** 3

**Category** Heavy

**Group** Plate
</row>

</column>

---

These suits of faceless full plate were first designed and distributed under Queen Ileosa's rule, but today, each new suit of this infamous style of plate armor is made by a Gray Maiden herself or a new member's sponsor.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-4" />
name: Gray Maiden Plate
